channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: "有人警告我：'贝尔莫潘是为新婚夫妇或濒临死亡的人准备的'，"这位艺术学校的校长谈到她离开沿海繁华的伯利兹城搬到贝尔莫潘时听到的评论。
item.description:
“Me advirtieron: ‘Belmopán es para los recién casados o los casi muertos’”, dijo la propietaria de una escuela de arte, sobre los comentarios que le hicieron cuando dejó la costera y bulliciosa Ciudad de Belice para mudarse a Belmopán. https://t.co/R3WIlnv8AX

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: "有人警告我说，'贝尔莫潘是为新婚夫妇或濒临死亡的人准备的'，"一位艺术学校的校主谈到她搬到贝尔莫潘时的反应时说，这里到处都是玛雅风格的布鲁特主义建筑，约有 25000 名居民。
item.description:
“I was warned, ‘Belmopan is for the newlyweds or the nearly deads,’” said the owner of an art school about the reactions when she moved to Belmopan, peppered with Maya-inspired Brutalist buildings and about 25,000 residents. https://t.co/dY8heZtnz5

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的发言人周三表示，阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼将于周五在莫斯科举行葬礼后下葬，葬礼将向公众开放，但目前尚不清楚当局是否会试图阻止人们参加葬礼。
item.description:
Alexéi Navalny será enterrado el viernes tras un funeral en Moscú que estará abierto al público, dijo el miércoles su portavoz, aunque no estaba claro si las autoridades tratarían de impedir que la gente asistiera. https://t.co/Zb9JQHDb9r

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 法国参议员周三支持将堕胎作为一项 "受保障的自由 "写入宪法的议案，法国离将堕胎写入宪法又近了一步。
item.description:
France took a step closer to enshrining access to abortion in its Constitution, after senators backed a bill on Wednesday to include it as a “guaranteed freedom” https://t.co/Eh7M0m6kXX

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 在数百名移民死于地中海翻船事故八个月后，调查人员周三表示，欧盟边境管理局（Frontex）缺乏预防未来海难的能力。
item.description:
Eight months after hundreds of migrants died in a capsizing on the Mediterranean, investigators said Wednesday that the European Union’s border agency, Frontex, lacks the ability to prevent future maritime disasters. https://t.co/JhBG8q5QLv

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: K-pop 明星具荷拉 28 岁时自杀身亡，这一消息震惊了韩国人--尽管这是近年来韩国年轻艺人自杀事件中的一起。这些死亡事件暴露了韩国娱乐业的阴暗面。
item.description:
When K-pop star Goo Hara died by suicide at age 28, the news shocked South Koreans — even as it was one of several among young Korean entertainers in recent years. The deaths have exposed a darker side to South Korea’s entertainment industry. https://t.co/xK7YI7QUYc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 德涅斯特河左岸是夹在乌克兰和摩尔多瓦之间的一片薄地，它于周三请求俄罗斯为其提供保护，重演了目前被莫斯科占领的乌克兰东部地区所上演的极易引发战火的一幕。
item.description:
Transnistria, a thin sliver of land sandwiched between Ukraine and Moldova, asked Russia on Wednesday to provide it with protection, repeating in miniature the highly flammable scenario played out by regions of eastern Ukraine now occupied by Moscow. https://t.co/YfltIYOR9N

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 高等法院法官裁定，政府有权改变对不再履行公务的王室成员的保护级别。
item.description:
Prince Harry lost a long-running legal battle over the downgrading of his security in Britain, as a High Court judge ruled that the government was entitled to change the level of protection for a royal who was no longer carrying out official duties. https://t.co/4ZSbSK8UXx

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 在以色列中部一片森林的边缘，预备役军人围着篝火，计划着他们的下一个任务：拯救这个严重分裂的国家。
item.description:
Gathered around a campfire on the edge of a forest in central Israel, reservists planned their next mission: saving their deeply divided country from itself. https://t.co/N5ajNOoFim

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 加纳议会通过了一项法案，进一步钳制 L.G.B.T.Q.的权利，对认定为同性恋或组成 L.G.B.T.Q.团体的人判处监禁。
item.description:
Ghana’s Parliament passed a bill that further clamps down on L.G.B.T.Q. rights by imposing jail terms on those who identify as gay or form L.G.B.T.Q. groups https://t.co/MZlqmjpPuW

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 伊朗将于 3 月 1 日举行议会选举，这是自 2022 年要求结束伊斯兰共和国统治的起义以来的首次大选。要求变革的呼声不绝于耳，许多伊朗人将抵制投票视为一种抗议行为。
item.description:
Iran is holding parliamentary elections on March 1, the first general vote since an uprising in 2022 which called for an end to the Islamic Republic’s rule. Demands for change endure and many Iranians view boycotting the vote as an act of protest. https://t.co/e0VYMUBcx3

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 马克龙先生经常喜欢挑衅而不是准备，即使他经常说得有道理，比如自2017年以来，他一直认为欧洲需要加强国防工业，以获得更大的战略影响力。
item.description:
Mr. Macron has often favored provocation over preparation, even if he often has a point, as in arguing since 2017 that Europe needed to bolster its defense industry to attain greater strategic heft. https://t.co/qk60rXWEoE

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 波斯尼亚正遭受低出生率和高移民率的打击，这一严峻的人口趋势正在加剧种族紧张关系。
item.description:
Bosnia is being hit by a low birthrate and high levels of emigration, a stark demographic trend that is fueling ethnic tensions. https://t.co/hDJkN07Usn

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 贝尔法斯特一家法院裁定，英国的一项新法律规定，在北爱尔兰被称为 "动乱 "的血腥教派冲突期间犯下罪行的人可以免于起诉，这违反了人权。
item.description:
A Belfast court ruled that a new British law granting people immunity from prosecution for crimes committed during Northern Ireland’s bloody sectarian conflict known as the Troubles would be a breach of human rights. https://t.co/75NaGPfRrM

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 提起位于伯利兹内陆深处的伯利兹首都贝尔莫潘，许多伯利兹人都会把这座城市贬低为笔杆子官僚的堡垒，不仅沉闷，而且没有夜生活
item.description:
Mention Belmopan, Belize’s capital, that sits deep in the country’s interior, and many Belizeans will belittle the city as a bastion of pencil-pushing bureaucrats that’s not just dull, but also devoid of nightlife https://t.co/0qwuHSEJy6

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的女发言人周三表示，纳瓦尔尼将于周五在莫斯科举行葬礼后下葬，葬礼将向公众开放，但目前还不清楚当局是否会试图阻止人们参加葬礼。
item.description:
Aleksei Navalny, will be buried on Friday after a funeral service in Moscow that will be open to the public, his spokeswoman said on Wednesday, although it was unclear whether the authorities would try to prevent people from attending. https://t.co/BdTru9zTtG

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 最近几天患上轻微流感的教皇方济各被送往罗马市中心的一家医院，这再次引发了人们对这位 87 岁教皇健康状况的担忧。梵蒂冈表示，他去做了 "一些诊断性检查"。
item.description:
Pope Francis, who has had a mild flu in recent days, was taken to a hospital in downtown Rome, reviving concerns about the 87-year old pontiff’s health. The Vatican said he had gone for “some diagnostic tests.” https://t.co/wRXIZTdAy4

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰官员说，一名备受瞩目的乌克兰前政治家本月早些时候因腐败指控被捕，指控与其过去的经历有关，他已成为该国获取武器努力的核心人物。
item.description:
A high-profile Ukrainian former politician who has become central to the country’s effort to obtain weapons was arrested earlier this month on corruption charges related to accusations about his past, officials said. https://t.co/Unn2r0YLZn

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 匈牙利议会批准瑞典成为北约新成员，使这个北欧国家扫清了阻碍其加入北约的最后障碍。
item.description:
El Parlamento de Hungría aprobó a Suecia como nuevo miembro de la OTAN, lo que permite al país nórdico salvar un último obstáculo que había bloqueado su ingreso en la alianza militar. https://t.co/dJIWlopHZI

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 颁奖典礼上的致辞往往令人过目不忘。但柏林电影节上的一些演讲却引发了关于反犹太主义和德国与以色列关系的激烈讨论。
item.description:
Award show speeches are often forgettable. But some speeches at the Berlin Film Festival have stirred heated debate over antisemitism and Germany’s relationship with Israel. https://t.co/aDbyZ1coZQ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 文件显示，国会山一名高级工作人员正接受国会调查，原因是他频繁前往乌克兰战区，并向乌克兰军方提供了他所说的价值 3 万美元的狙击装备。
item.description:
A senior Capitol Hill staff member is under congressional investigation over his frequent trips to Ukraine’s war zones and providing what he said was $30,000 in sniper gear to its military, documents show. https://t.co/0yH28zBjfX

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 美国国会山的一名助手曾吹嘘自己向乌克兰运送过军事装备，国会将对他是否 "被外国情报机构利用 "进行调查。
item.description:
A Capitol Hill aide who boasted that he delivered military gear to Ukraine faces a congressional inquiry into whether he was being “exploited by a foreign intelligence entity.” https://t.co/i6CXkMZrfB

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 欧洲领导人将齐聚巴黎，试图展示他们支持乌克兰的团结和决心。
item.description:
European leaders are set to gather in Paris in an attempt to showcase unity and resolve in their support for Ukraine. https://t.co/wruTCp3LYa

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯军队仍然比乌克兰军队更愿意承受兵力和装备上的巨大损失，即使是为了取得微小的战果。
item.description:
Russia’s military is still far more willing than Ukraine’s to absorb big losses in troops and equipment, even to make small gains. https://t.co/bWSoqeh0XG

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 克里姆林宫周二警告说，北约在乌克兰当地驻军将不可避免地导致俄罗斯与西方军事联盟之间的直接对抗。
item.description:
The Kremlin warned on Tuesday that NATO troops on the ground in Ukraine would inevitably lead to a direct confrontation between Russia and the Western military alliance. https://t.co/KCFLab4uYp

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 西班牙巴伦西亚地区政府领导人宣布，在一栋高层住宅发生火灾造成至少四人死亡后，将举行为期三天的哀悼活动。
item.description:
The leader of the regional government in Valencia, Spain, announced a three-day period of mourning after a fire in a high-rise residential building killed at least four people. https://t.co/CPWTCQ3nmO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 东欧国家白俄罗斯周日提供了一种民主不可预测性的替代方案：在议会选举中，没有一名候选人批评该国的专制领导人。
item.description:
The East European nation of Belarus on Sunday offered an alternative to the unpredictability of democracy: a vote for Parliament without a single candidate critical of the country’s despotic leader. https://t.co/1qFjVr7Dsg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 去年，数百名美国儿童因肉桂味苹果酱袋中含有高剂量的铅而中毒。纽约时报》和 @examinationnews 获得的记录显示，这些污染是如何一次又一次地被忽视。
item.description:
Hundreds of American children were poisoned last year by cinnamon-flavored applesauce pouches containing high doses of lead. Records obtained by The New York Times and @examinationnews show how, time and again, the contamination went unnoticed. https://t.co/2IRw6Q8a3Y

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 北约的扩张--芬兰去年加入，瑞典不久也将加入--是俄罗斯入侵乌克兰的反击，而俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普尔廷可能没有预料到这一点。
item.description:
NATO’s expansion, with Finland’s joining last year and soon Sweden, is a blowback from Russia’s invasion of Ukraine that President Vladimir Pultin may not have calculated. https://t.co/6KOJVZrkN2

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 加拿大扩大了对 2022 年北京奥运会花样滑冰团体奖牌的争夺。加拿大要求获得铜牌，认为国际滑冰官员在剥夺俄罗斯的金牌时计算错误。通过 @tariqpanja：
item.description:
Canada extended the fight over the team figure skating medals from the 2022 Beijing Olympics. It is demanding the bronze, arguing that international skating officials got the math wrong when they stripped Russia of the gold. Via @tariqpanja: https://t.co/D9ZX0lrD3m

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024
